ground_truth: People clap as Holden looks at her, and the Singer on stage speaks into the microphone. The crowd applauds, and Alyssa shakes her head, smiling. Holden pokes her, but Alyssa shakes her head no. The crowd urges her, and Alyssa offers the Singer an embarrassed half-smile before Holden pushes her forward. Alyssa shakes her head and relents, heading through the crowd as the crowd thunders. Banky and Hooper stand at the bar while the crowd cheers and Alyssa laughs. She turns to the band, says something, and they nod before she turns back to the crowd. Holden smiles as Alyssa launches into a torchy tune. Banky joins him, and Holden glances at him. Banky offers a mocking mimic of his smile as Holden is smiling, being seduced, while Banky rolls his eyes. Beside Holden stands a pretty girl with a short haircut who's also riveted by Alyssa's performance. Alyssa makes big-time eye contact with somebody out there, and the song seems to be aimed at whoever she's looking at. At the end of the song, the crowd goes wild, but Alyssa is preoccupied. She points to someone in the crowd and curls her finger back in a `c'mere' fashion, urging whoever it is to join her before she jumps off the stage. Holden shakes his head sheepishly and looks downward, aw-shucks style, at that moment the girl beside him leaps forward. Alyssa and the girl race into each other's arms and fall into a way-too-passionate-to-mean-anything-else kiss. Holden looks up and is suddenly taken aback as Banky's eyes widen, and he allows a smile to creep across his face as the crowd applauds. Holden's eyes bug as Banky looks around, and for the first time, we get the distinct impression that this is a lesbian bar with a lot of chicks in this place. Holden continues to stare - mouth agape, while Banky looks at Holden and slaps him on the back. Alyssa and the girl continue to kiss as Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl from the dance floor sit around a table. Alyssa and the girl continue to make out while Holden and Banky casually watch, wide-eyed. Banky stares a little harder, and Holden hits him. Alyssa and the girl break their kiss, and Kim exits. Alyssa looks at him, and Banky is smiling ear-to-ear as Banky and Alyssa laugh. Holden looks at a small scar on his arm and thinks better about mentioning it as then Kim re-enters and plants a big kiss on Alyssa's neck. Alyssa waves at him as he exits, and Banky slides out of the booth before Holden reaches in and pulls Banky out. Alyssa watches them go, then turns and kisses Kim. Holden looks preoccupied as the Receptionist stops typing and looks at Banky, shocked. Banky flips through magazines, biting off mini pieces of the gum he's chewing before John Sloss, the boy's lawyer, joins them.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Individuals applaud as Holden gazes at her, and the Vocalist on platform speaks into the microphone. The throng cheers, and Alyssa moves her head, grinning. Holden nudges her, but Alyssa moves her head no. The throng encourages her, and Alyssa gives the Vocalist an awkward partial-smile before Holden propels her onward. Alyssa moves her head and concedes, making her way through the throng as the throng roars. Banky and Hooper stand at the counter while the throng acclaims and Alyssa chuckles. She turns to the ensemble, says something, and they nod before she turns back to the throng. Holden grins as Alyssa begins a soulful melody. Banky joins him, and Holden glimpses at him. Banky gives a taunting imitation of his grin as Holden is grinning, being captivated, while Banky rolls his eyes. Beside Holden stands an attractive girl with a brief haircut who's also mesmerized by Alyssa's show. Alyssa creates substantial eye contact with somebody out there, and the tune appears to be directed at whoever she's gazing at. At the conclusion of the tune, the throng goes wild, but Alyssa is occupied. She indicates someone in the throng and curls her finger back in a `c'mere' style, encouraging whoever it is to join her before she leaps off the platform. Holden moves his head bashfully and looks downward, aw-shucks manner, at that moment the girl beside him springs forward. Alyssa and the girl dash into each other's arms and tumble into a way-too-passionate-to-mean-anything-else embrace. Holden looks up and is suddenly astounded as Banky's eyes widen, and he permits a grin to slide across his face as the throng cheers. Holden's eyes goggle as Banky looks around, and for the first time, we get the distinct notion that this is a lesbian tavern with a lot of women in this locale. Holden continues to gape - mouth agape, while Banky looks at Holden and pats him on the back. Alyssa and the girl continue to kiss as Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl from the dance floor sit around a table. Alyssa and the girl continue to make out while Holden and Banky casually observe, wide-eyed. Banky stares a little harder, and Holden hits him. Alyssa and the girl break their kiss, and Kim departs. Alyssa looks at him, and Banky is grinning ear-to-ear as Banky and Alyssa chuckle. Holden looks at a small mark on his arm and reconsiders mentioning it as then Kim re-enters and plants a big embrace on Alyssa's neck. Alyssa waves at him as he departs, and Banky slides out of the booth before Holden reaches in and pulls Banky out. Alyssa watches them go, then turns and kisses Kim. Holden looks occupied as the Receptionist stops typing and looks at Banky, astonished. Banky flips through periodicals, biting off tiny pieces of the gum he's chewing before John Sloss, the boy's attorney, joins them.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Applause is given by people as she is looked at by Holden, and the microphone is spoken into by the Singer on stage. Applause is given by the crowd, and her head is shaken by Alyssa, smiling. She is poked by Holden, but Alyssa shakes her head no. Alyssa is urged by the crowd, and an embarrassed half-smile is offered to the Singer by Alyssa before she is pushed forward by Holden. Her head is shaken and Alyssa relents, heading through the crowd as the crowd thunders. The bar is stood at by Banky and Hooper while cheers are made by the crowd and Alyssa laughs. She turns to the band, says something, and nods are given by them before she turns back to the crowd. As Alyssa launches into a torchy tune, smiles are given by Holden. Banky joins him, and glances are given to him by Holden. A mocking mimic of his smile is offered by Banky as Holden is smiling, being seduced, while his eyes are rolled by Banky. Beside Holden stands a pretty girl with a short haircut who is also riveted by Alyssa's performance. Big-time eye contact is made by Alyssa with somebody out there, and the song seems to be aimed at whoever is looked at by her. At the end of the song, wildness comes from the crowd, but preoccupation occurs for Alyssa. Someone in the crowd is pointed to by her, and a `c'mere' fashion finger curl is made by Alyssa, urging whoever it is to join before a jump off the stage is made by her. Sheepish head shaking and downward looking is done by Holden, aw-shucks style, at that moment, a leap forward is made by the girl beside him. Alyssa and the girl race into each other's arms and fall into a way-too-passionate-to-mean-anything-else kiss. Looking up and being suddenly taken aback occurs for Holden as an eye-widening occurs for Banky, and a creeping smile is allowed across his face as applause is given by the crowd. Bugged-out eyes happen for Holden as Banky looks around, and for the first impression, this place is realized to be a lesbian bar with a lot of chicks. Continuing to stare - mouth agape, occurs for Holden, while Banky looks at Holden and back-slapping is done by him. Kissing continues between Alyssa and the girl as Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl from the dance floor sit around a table. Kissing continues between Alyssa and the girl while wide-eyed watching casually is done by Holden and Banky. A harder stare is given by Banky, and a hit is given to him by Holden. A break in their kiss occurs for Alyssa and the girl, and Kim exits. A look is given to him by Alyssa, and an ear-to-ear smile happens for Banky as laughter is shared by Banky and Alyssa. A small scar on his arm is looked at by Holden, and better thinking about mentioning it happens as a re-entry by Kim occurs with a big neck kiss planted on Alyssa. A wave is given to him by Alyssa as he exits, and a booth slide-out is done by Banky before a pull-out of Banky is done by Holden. Watching them go happens for Alyssa, then a turn and a kiss with Kim occurs. Preoccupation is displayed by Holden as typing is stopped by the Receptionist who looks at Banky, shocked. Magazine flipping is done by Banky, and mini pieces of the gum he's chewing are bitten off before a join by John Sloss, the boy's lawyer, occurs.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Holden watches as people clap, and the Singer speaks into the mic. Alyssa shakes her head, smiling, as Holden urges her forward. She reluctantly heads through the cheering crowd. At the bar, Banky and Hooper watch Alyssa laugh and turn to the band, who nod as she begins a torchy tune. Banky mimics Holden's smile as a girl beside Holden is captivated by Alyssa's performance. Alyssa makes eye contact with someone while singing, and at the song's end, she beckons them forward. Holden looks down sheepishly as the girl beside him leaps to Alyssa; they share a passionate kiss. Holden is startled, and Banky smiles as the crowd applauds. The scene reveals it's a lesbian bar filled with women. Later, Holden, Banky, Alyssa, and the girl sit at a table, with Alyssa and her partner kissing. Holden hits Banky for staring too hard. The girl, Kim, exits after kissing Alyssa, who exchanges smiles with Banky. Holden looks at a scar and decides not to mention it. Kim returns, kisses Alyssa's neck, and then exits again. Banky and Holden leave while Alyssa and Kim kiss. Holden remains distracted as Banky chews gum, flipping through magazines, and John Sloss, their lawyer, arrives.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: People clap as Holden watches her, and the Singer speaks into the microphone. The crowd applauds, Alyssa shakes her head, smiling. Holden pokes her, but she refuses. Encouraged by the crowd, Alyssa reluctantly moves forward as the cheers grow. Banky and Hooper stand at the bar while Alyssa laughs, speaking to the band before turning back to the crowd. Holden smiles as Alyssa begins a heartfelt song. Banky joins him, mocking Holden’s smile, while a pretty girl beside Holden is captivated by Alyssa's performance. Alyssa connects intensely with someone, making the song personal. As the song ends, Alyssa gestures for someone to join her, jumps off the stage, and embraces the girl beside Holden, sharing a passionate kiss. Holden is stunned while Banky smiles as the crowd cheers. It's clear this is a lesbian bar. Banky slaps Holden's back, and they sit around a table with Alyssa and the girl, who continue kissing. Holden watches, wide-eyed, hitting Banky when he stares harder. Alyssa and the girl pause as Kim exits, then re-entering to kiss Alyssa’s neck. Alyssa waves and watches Holden and Banky leave, turning back to kiss Kim. Holden looks distracted as the Receptionist notices Banky, who flips through magazines before John Sloss, their lawyer, arrives.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As the lively crowd erupts into applause, Holden's gaze is fixed intently on her, while the Singer on stage leans into the microphone to address the audience. The enthusiastic crowd continues its applause, prompting Alyssa to shake her head with a smile spreading across her face. Holden playfully nudges her, but Alyssa shakes her head in refusal. The crowd's excitement grows, encouraging Alyssa even further as she offers the Singer an embarrassed yet acknowledging half-smile, just before Holden gently nudges her forward. Reluctantly, Alyssa gives in, making her way purposefully through the crowd, which is now roaring with anticipation. Meanwhile, Banky and Hooper can be seen standing at the bar, taking it all in as the crowd's cheers reach a crescendo, and Alyssa lets out an amused laugh. Turning her attention to the band, she exchanges a few words with them, and they nod in understanding before she faces the eager crowd once more. As Alyssa launches into a soulful and emotional song, Holden’s face lights up with a bright smile. Banky joins him, and Holden glances sideways at him. Banky returns the glance with a playful imitation of his smile, expressing mockery, while Holden, fully captivated, continues to smile. Banky, unable to help himself, rolls his eyes in response. 

Beside Holden stands an attractive girl with a short haircut, completely engrossed in Alyssa’s captivating performance. Alyssa's eyes lock with someone in the audience, and it's apparent that the song is being directed at the person she is intensely focusing on. As the song reaches its conclusion, the crowd erupts into cheers, but Alyssa seems deep in thought, momentarily distracted. She gestures towards someone in the crowd, beckoning them with a curling finger to join her before she leaps gracefully off the stage. Holden shakes his head in embarrassment, looking downward with a bashful demeanor, just as the girl beside him eagerly jumps forward. Alyssa and this girl rush into each other's embrace, engaging in a kiss so passionate that it can mean nothing other than sincere emotion. 

Holden’s gaze lifts, and he is suddenly caught off guard, his eyes widening in surprise as Banky’s eyes do the same, a knowing smile slowly spreading across his face while the crowd cheers enthusiastically. Holden’s eyes nearly pop out in astonishment as Banky surveys the room, and, for the first time, we get a distinct sense that this is a bar frequented by women with a particular preference. Holden continues to stare in disbelief, his mouth hanging open, while Banky turns to him and gives him a friendly slap on the back. Alyssa and the girl remain enveloped in each other's arms, sharing kisses as Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl gather around a table. Alyssa and the girl continue their affectionate display, leaving Holden and Banky observing them with wide-eyed curiosity. Banky fixes his gaze a little more intently, prompting Holden to give him a nudge. 

Eventually, Alyssa and the girl break their kiss, and Kim momentarily exits. Alyssa's eyes meet his, and Banky's face breaks into a broad smile, both he and Alyssa sharing a hearty laugh. Holden notices a small scar on his arm but thinks better of mentioning it when Kim reappears and affectionately kisses Alyssa’s neck. Alyssa waves him off as he departs, and Banky begins to slide out of the booth, only for Holden to reach in and pull him out. Alyssa watches the two of them leave, then turns back to embrace Kim. Holden appears lost in thought when the Receptionist stops typing, looking at Banky with visible surprise. Meanwhile, Banky flips through a few magazines, intermittently biting off small pieces of the gum he's chewing, until John Sloss, the boys’ lawyer, arrives to join them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As the lively and energetic crowd bursts into enthusiastic applause, Holden's gaze remains firmly and intently fixed on Alyssa, while the Singer, who is standing on stage, leans towards the microphone with a readiness to address the eager audience. The crowd, filled with enthusiasm, continues with their applause, prompting Alyssa to shake her head gently, a smile gradually spreading across her face. Holden, in a playful manner, nudges her, but Alyssa resolutely shakes her head in refusal. The excitement from the crowd grows even more intense, encouraging Alyssa further as she offers the Singer an embarrassed yet acknowledging half-smile, just before Holden gives her a gentle nudge forward. Reluctantly, Alyssa gives in, making her way purposefully and determinedly through the crowd, which is now roaring with eager anticipation. Meanwhile, Banky and Hooper can be seen standing at the bar, observing everything with interest as the crowd's cheers reach a crescendo, and Alyssa lets out an amused laugh. Turning her attention to the band, she exchanges a few brief words with them, and they nod in understanding before she faces the eager crowd once more. As Alyssa launches into a soulful and deeply emotional song, Holden’s face lights up with a bright, genuine smile. Banky joins him, and Holden glances sideways at his friend. Banky returns the glance with a playful imitation of Holden's smile, expressing mockery, while Holden, fully captivated, continues to smile. Unable to help himself, Banky rolls his eyes in response.

Beside Holden stands an attractive girl with a short haircut, completely captivated and engrossed in Alyssa’s captivating performance. Alyssa's eyes lock intently with someone in the audience, and it's apparent that this heartfelt song is being directed at the person she is intensely focusing on. As the song reaches its powerful conclusion, the crowd erupts into cheers, but Alyssa seems deep in thought, momentarily distracted. She gestures towards someone in the crowd, beckoning them with a curling finger to join her before she leaps gracefully off the stage. Holden shakes his head in embarrassment, looking downward with a bashful demeanor, just as the girl beside him eagerly jumps forward. Alyssa and this girl rush into each other's arms, engaging in a kiss so passionate that it can mean nothing other than sincere emotion.

Holden’s gaze lifts, and he is suddenly caught off guard, his eyes widening in genuine surprise as Banky’s eyes do the same, a knowing smile slowly spreading across his face while the crowd cheers enthusiastically. Holden’s eyes nearly pop out in astonishment as Banky surveys the room, and, for the first time, we get a distinct sense that this is a bar frequented by women with a particular preference. Holden continues to stare in utter disbelief, his mouth hanging open slightly, while Banky turns to him and gives him a friendly, reassuring slap on the back. Alyssa and the girl remain enveloped in each other's arms, sharing kisses as Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl gather around a table. Alyssa and the girl continue their affectionate display, leaving Holden and Banky observing them with wide-eyed curiosity. Banky fixes his gaze a little more intently, prompting Holden to give him a gentle nudge.

Eventually, Alyssa and the girl break their kiss, and Kim momentarily exits. Alyssa's eyes meet his, and Banky's face breaks into a broad smile, both he and Alyssa sharing a hearty laugh. Holden notices a small scar on his arm but thinks better of mentioning it when Kim reappears and affectionately kisses Alyssa’s neck. Alyssa waves him off as he departs, and Banky begins to slide out of the booth, only for Holden to reach in and pull him out. Alyssa watches the two of them leave, then turns back to embrace Kim. Holden appears lost in thought when the Receptionist suddenly stops typing, looking at Banky with visible surprise. Meanwhile, Banky flips through a few magazines, intermittently biting off small pieces of the gum he's chewing, until John Sloss, the boys’ lawyer, arrives to join them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the crowd's excitement fills the air, people enthusiastically clap while Holden directs his gaze towards her. On stage, the Singer confidently leans into the microphone to address the audience. The applause from the crowd grows louder as Alyssa, standing amongst them, shakes her head with a smile playing on her lips, subtly expressing her reluctance. Holden gently nudges her to encourage participation, but Alyssa again shakes her head to refuse. The crowd begins to urge her fervently, and Alyssa, after briefly hesitating, offers the Singer a bashful half-smile, despite her evident embarrassment. As Holden gives her a little push forward, Alyssa concedes to the crowd's insistence and starts making her way through the throng of people who are now roaring with enthusiasm. Observing the scene from the bar, Banky and Hooper stand amused as the crowd erupts in cheers while Alyssa bursts into laughter. Alyssa turns on her heel to face the band, exchanges a few words with them, and receives a nod in response before turning back to acknowledge the crowd's anticipation. Meanwhile, Holden watches, his face lighting up with a smile, as Alyssa launches into a soulful, torchy tune that captivates everyone present. Banky steps beside Holden, who takes a moment to glance at him, while Banky gives a playful, exaggerated mimicry of Holden's own smile, which begins to look somewhat seductive. As Holden remains enraptured, Banky rolls his eyes in mock exasperation. Next to Holden, a pretty girl with a short haircut is also fully engrossed in Alyssa's performance, her attention unwavering. Alyssa, mid-performance, makes deliberate and intense eye contact with someone in the audience, suggesting the song is directed towards that particular individual. Once Alyssa concludes her song, the crowd erupts into wild applause. However, Alyssa appears distracted and points to someone in the audience, beckoning them with a curled finger in a 'come here' gesture. As she gracefully leaps off the stage, Holden, caught off guard, shakes his head sheepishly and casts his eyes downward in an 'aw-shucks' manner. It's at this moment that the girl next to him springs forward with eagerness. Alyssa and the girl rush into each other's arms and share a kiss that is undeniably passionate, leaving no room for misinterpretation. Astonished, Holden lifts his gaze, suddenly taken aback by the unfolding scene. Banky's eyes widen in realization, and a slow, amused smile begins to spread across his face as the crowd continues its applause. Holden's eyes almost pop out in disbelief as Banky, looking around, starts to grasp the atmosphere, giving the audience the clear impression that they are indeed in a lesbian bar teeming with women. As Holden continues to gape, mouth agape, Banky turns to him and slaps him on the back in a friendly yet teasing manner. Meanwhile, Alyssa and the girl remain engrossed in their kiss. As time passes, Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl from the dance floor find themselves seated around a table. Alyssa and the girl remain absorbed in each other, continuing their public display of affection as Holden and Banky watch, wide-eyed, slightly taken aback by the scene before them. Banky's gaze becomes more intense as he stares, prompting Holden to give him a light-hearted hit to bring him back to reality. Eventually, Alyssa and the girl end their kiss, and Kim exits briefly. Alyssa shares a meaningful look with Holden, and Banky, who is now grinning from ear to ear, begins to laugh alongside Alyssa. Holden's attention is momentarily drawn to a small scar on his arm, contemplating whether or not to talk about it but ultimately deciding against it as Kim re-enters the room and romantically plants a big kiss on Alyssa's neck. Alyssa, smiling, waves goodbye to Holden as he exits, while Banky slides out of the booth, prompting Holden to follow suit by reaching in to pull Banky out with him. Alyssa looks after them as they leave, then turns her attention back to Kim and kisses her. Meanwhile, Holden appears deep in thought as the Receptionist, pausing her typing, glances at Banky with a look of surprise. Unfazed, Banky idly flips through magazines, casually biting off small pieces of the gum he is chewing, until their lawyer, John Sloss, joins them, adding another layer to the scene's unfolding drama.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The crowd erupts in applause as Holden and Alyssa exchange looks, the Singer on stage speaking into the microphone. Urged by the audience and with a nudge from Holden, Alyssa initially refuses but then relents, moving toward the stage with an embarrassed smile. Banky and Hooper watch from the bar as the crowd cheers and Alyssa begins a torchy tune with a nod to the band. Alyssa's captivating performance includes direct eye contact with someone in the crowd, seemingly directing her song at them. As the song concludes, Alyssa signals for someone to join her and leaps off the stage, prompting a girl beside Holden to race forward into Alyssa's arms, culminating in a passionate kiss. 

Holden, taken aback, realizes the setting is a lesbian bar, with Banky acknowledging this discovery with a smile. As the crowd applauds, Holden is still in shock while Banky playfully nudges him. The scene shifts to a table where Alyssa and the girl continue their affectionate display, with Holden and Banky watching wide-eyed. Banky stares intently until Holden intervenes. When the girl, Kim, briefly departs and returns, Alyssa reciprocates her affection with a kiss, and Holden distracts himself with a scar on his arm. As Alyssa waves goodbye, Banky and Holden exit, with Banky playfully flipping through magazines while chewing gum, before being joined by their lawyer, John Sloss.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: People clap as Holden, a regular at this lively music venue known for its eclectic mix of performers, looks at her, and the Singer, a local favorite renowned for her soulful voice, speaks into the microphone. The crowd, composed mostly of enthusiastic fans of indie music, applauds, and Alyssa shakes her head, smiling. Holden pokes her, but Alyssa, known for her modesty during public performances, shakes her head no. The crowd urges her, and Alyssa offers the Singer an embarrassed half-smile before Holden, her close friend who often encourages her, pushes her forward. Alyssa shakes her head and relents, heading through the crowd as the crowd thunders in the small and dimly-lit venue. Banky and Hooper, two friends often found at the bar during these events, stand at the bar while the crowd cheers and Alyssa laughs. She turns to the band, a group of musicians who have played together for years, says something, and they nod before she turns back to the crowd. Holden smiles as Alyssa launches into a torchy tune, a style she is particularly admired for. Banky joins him, and Holden glances at him. Banky offers a mocking mimic of his smile as Holden is smiling, being seduced by the music, while Banky rolls his eyes. Beside Holden stands a pretty girl with a short haircut who's also riveted by Alyssa's performance. Alyssa makes big-time eye contact with somebody out there, perhaps singling out a familiar face, and the song seems to be aimed at whoever she's looking at. At the end of the song, the crowd goes wild, but Alyssa is preoccupied. She points to someone in the crowd and curls her finger back in a 'c'mere' fashion, urging whoever it is to join her before she jumps off the stage. Holden shakes his head sheepishly and looks downward, aw-shucks style, at that moment the girl beside him, who has been eagerly anticipating this, leaps forward. Alyssa and the girl race into each other's arms and fall into a way-too-passionate-to-mean-anything-else kiss, revealing a deeper connection than previously realized. Holden looks up and is suddenly taken aback as Banky's eyes widen, and he allows a smile to creep across his face as the crowd applauds. Holden's eyes bug as Banky looks around, and for the first time, we get the distinct impression that this is a lesbian bar, a revelation given the dynamic with a lot of chicks in this place. Holden continues to stare—mouth agape, while Banky looks at Holden and slaps him on the back in a reassuring manner. Alyssa and the girl continue to kiss as Banky, Holden, Alyssa, and the girl from the dance floor sit around a table in the back corner, where intimate conversations often unfold. Alyssa and the girl continue to make out while Holden and Banky casually watch, wide-eyed at the unfolding drama. Banky stares a little harder, and Holden hits him lightly, as if to remind him of their surroundings. Alyssa and the girl break their kiss momentarily, and Kim, as she is now known, exits. Alyssa looks at him, and Banky is smiling ear-to-ear as Banky and Alyssa laugh, sharing a moment of camaraderie. Holden looks at a small scar on his arm, a reminder of a past adventure, and thinks better about mentioning it as then Kim re-enters and plants a big kiss on Alyssa's neck. Alyssa waves at him as he exits, and Banky slides out of the booth before Holden reaches in and pulls Banky out, their friendship evident in the ease of their interactions. Alyssa watches them go, then turns and kisses Kim, sealing the affection with a sense of freedom. Holden looks preoccupied as the Receptionist, who works at the legal office they frequently visit, stops typing and looks at Banky, shocked by his sudden presence. Banky flips through magazines, biting off mini pieces of the gum he's chewing, a familiar habit, before John Sloss, the boy's lawyer, known for his competent yet approachable demeanor, joins them.

Holden pokes her but Alyssa shakes her head. no. The crowd urges her and Alyssa offers the Singer an embarrassed halfsmile before Holden pushes her forward. Holden shakes his head sheepishly and looks downward awshucks style. at that moment the girl beside him leaps forward. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Alyssa and the girl race into each other's arms and fall into a waytoopassionatetomeananythingelse kiss. Holden looks up and is suddenly taken aback as Banky's eyes widen and he allows a smile to creep across his face as the crowd applauds. Holden's eyes bug as Banky looks around and for the first time we get the distinct impression that this is a lesbian bar with a lot of chicks in this place. Holden continues to stare  mouth agape while Banky looks at Holden and slaps him on the back. Alyssa and the girl continue to kiss as Banky. Holden Alyssa and the girl from the dance floor sit around a table. Alyssa and the girl continue to make out while Holden and Banky casually watch wideeyed. Banky stares a little harder and Holden hits him. Alyssa and the girl break their kiss and Kim exits. Alyssa looks at him and Banky is smiling eartoear as Banky and Alyssa laugh. Holden looks at a small scar on his arm and thinks better about mentioning it as. then Kim reenters and plants a big kiss on Alyssa's neck. Alyssa waves at him as he exits and Banky slides out of the booth before Holden reaches in and pulls Banky out. Alyssa watches them go then turns and kisses Kim. Holden looks preoccupied as the Receptionist stops typing and looks at. Banky shocked. Banky flips through magazines biting off mini pieces of the gum he is chewing before John Sloss. the boy's lawyer joins them.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: People clap as Holden looks at her and the Singer on stage speaks into the microphone. The crowd applauds and Alyssa shakes her head smiling. Holden pokes her but Alyssa shakes her head. no. The crowd urges her and Alyssa offers the Singer an embarrassed halfsmile before Holden pushes her forward. Alyssa shakes her head and relents heading through the crowd as the crowd thunders. Banky and Hooper stand at the bar while the crowd cheers and Alyssa laughs. She turns to the band says something and they nod before she turns back to the crowd. Holden smiles as Alyssa launches into a torchy tune. Banky joins him and Holden glances at him. Banky offers a mocking mimic of his smile as Holden is smiling being seduced while Banky rolls his eyes. Beside Holden stands a pretty girl with a short haircut who is also riveted by Alyssa's performance. Alyssa makes bigtime eye contact with somebody out there and the song seems to be aimed at whoever she is looking at. At the end of the song the crowd goes wild but Alyssa is preoccupied. She points to someone in the crowd and curls her finger back in a c'mere' fashion urging whoever it is to join her before she jumps off the stage. Holden shakes his head sheepishly and looks downward awshucks style. at that moment the girl beside him leaps forward. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Crows caw as Baxter glances at him, and the Juggler on the platform murmurs into the megaphone. The assembly giggles, and Margo nods her nose, frowning. Baxter taps him, but Margo nods her chin yes. The assembly encourages him, and Margo delivers the Juggler a shy full-glance before Baxter pulls him backward. Margo nods her nose and consents, marching away from the assembly as the assembly whispers. Clark and Duncan hop at the stall while the assembly chuckles and Margo cries. He spins to the choir, mutters something, and they shake before he spins back to the assembly. Baxter frowns as Margo leaps into a lively waltz. Clark joins him, and Baxter peeks at him. Clark delivers a sincere replica of his frown as Baxter is frowning, being swayed, while Clark rolls his toes. Beside Baxter stands a jolly boy with a long ponytail who's also distracted by Margo's recital. Margo avoids small-time ear contact with no one in here, and the dance feels to be directed at nobody she's staring at. At the start of the dance, the assembly falls silent, but Margo is focused. He waves to everyone in the assembly and opens his fist back in a `stay there' style, pushing no one out to leave him before he crawls onto the platform. Baxter nods his chin boldly and gazes upward, aw-peeks manner, at that point the boy beside him bounds backward. Margo and the boy tiptoe into each other's legs and rise into a way-too-gentle-to-mean-nothing-more hug. Baxter gazes down and is suddenly relaxed as Clark's toes narrow, and he denies a frown to hide under his head as the assembly mutters. Baxter's toes relax as Clark covers around, and for the last time, we miss the fuzzy memory that this is a jazz club with a handful of dudes in this spot. Baxter ceases to blink - beak closed, while Clark covers at Baxter and taps him on the chin. Margo and the boy cease to hug as Clark, Baxter, Margo, and the boy from the stage ceiling stand around a lamp. Margo and the boy cease to break in while Baxter and Clark effortlessly cover, narrow-eyed. Clark covers a little softer, and Baxter misses him. Margo and the boy cease their break, and Lee enters. Margo covers at him, and Clark is glaring ear-to-ear as Clark and Margo cower. Baxter covers at a big mole on his foot and dreams worse about denying it as then Lee races in and drags a small miss on Margo's toes. Margo frowns at him as he enters, and Clark jumps into the seat before Baxter reaches out and pushes Clark in. Margo avoids them stand, then turns and breaks Lee. Baxter covers focused as the Gardener begins painting and covers at Clark, excited. Clark stares past scripts, spitting out giant chunks of the candy he's swallowing before Marie Hood, the girl's chef, departs them.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Holden watches as the crowd applauds Alyssa, who hesitantly takes the stage to sing. The audience, including Holden and the skeptical Banky, are captivated by her performance. Alyssa's song appears directed at someone specific, and as she finishes, she signals them to join her. When Holden sheepishly steps back, a girl beside him leaps forward, and she and Alyssa share a passionate kiss, revealing the venue as a lesbian bar. Holden is surprised, while Banky finds it amusing. Alyssa continues to kiss the girl, named Kim, as Banky and Holden watch, wide-eyed. After Kim departs, Alyssa shares a laugh with Banky, who smiles broadly. Kim returns to embrace Alyssa, prompting Holden and Banky to leave. Alyssa waves them off, then focuses on Kim. Meanwhile, Banky flips through magazines as their lawyer joins them.
